thread.title: As fans speculate about Mick and Whitney's future take a look back at EastEnders' most SCANDALOUS affairs
thread.title_full: As fans speculate about Mick and Whitney's future take a look back at EastEnders' most SCANDALOUS affairs

author: JJ Nattrass
title: As fans speculate about Mick and Whitney's future take a look back at EastEnders' most SCANDALOUS affairs
text:
TV As fans speculate about Mick and Whitney's future take a look back at EastEnders' most SCANDALOUS affairs From Max and Stacey to Pat and Frank, Albert Square has been the location of some very passionate extra-marital plotlines Share Get soaps   Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Her marriage to his son has just broken down, and they've already shared one tempting kiss. 
And, it would seem, that EastEnders ' loyal fans are firmly in the opinion that if Whitney Dean moves in with Mick Carter and the rest of his brood the only certain outcome will be a scandalous affair . 
Having been ditched unceremoniously by Mick's son, Lee, Whitney (Shona McGarty) has been invited by the Queen Vic's Landlord to live with the family above the pub, creating quite a stir with viewers. 
With that in mind Mirror TV looks back on some of the soap's most shocking and truly scandalous affairs from over the years. Could Mick and Whitney be the next affair that rock the Square? (Photo: BBC) 
Max Branning and Stacey Slater 
One of EastEnders truly jaw-dropping moments, as the pair relentlessly pursued an affair behind Tanya and Bradley's backs. 
Despite having a perfect home-life with Tanya and their two daughters, Max couldn't keep his hands off of his own son's fiance. 
But, in the end, the passion fizzled out - at least for Stacey - and the affair ended - but not before Lauren (Max's feisty daughter) found out, teeing up an explosive Christmas storyline. 
Following her dream wedding to Bradley, the happy couple do what all newly-weds do, and join one set of in-laws for Christmas Day. 
Unfortunately Stacey's present from Lauren is a DVD that shows her and Max kissing on her wedding day to Bradley. And, with the whole family watching it in the sitting room, all Hell breaks loose. Read More Max Branning and Stacey Slater managed to upset the apple cart at Christmas (Photo: BBC) 
Frank Butcher and Pat Evans 
Possibly one of the most unlikely and longest-lasting love triangles EVER occurred when Frank Butcher fell for both Pat (Butcher) and Peggy Mitchell. 
One of the most memorable twists and turns of the ever-complicated relationship between the three iconic characters came after Frank had married Peggy. 
With Pat married to Roy - and the two having weathered both financials and personal problems - and Frank "happily" married to Peggy Mitchell, the two couples decided to head for a fun holiday in Spain. 
However - as always with the residents of Walford - drama wasn't far off, and it didn't take Frank long to set his sights back on Pat. 
Left alone in the villa by Roy and Peggy, Frank seduces Pat, and the former lovers end up in bed together. 
But, with it being a couples' holiday, Roy and Peggy return and find the pair in bed - with predictable and very explosive consequences. Read More Frank Butcher just couldn't keep his hands off of old-flame Pat, in Spain (Photo: BBC) 
Bianca Jackson and Dan Sullivan 
It was trouble from the start where Bianca and Dan were concerned, as the two had a history that viewers were made aware of right from the get-go. 
Having finally walked down the aisle, and married Ricky Butcher, Bianca looked all set to live a relatively quiet life with Frank's golden boy. 
But following the birth of their son Liam, Bianca's mother, Carol, returned to Albert Square with a new man of her own, Dan Sullivan. 
Unbeknown to Carol, Dan and Bianca had enjoyed a relationship when her daughter was only a teen. 
Despite Bianca making plans with Ricky and Carol being pregnant with Dan's child, the two of them can't manage to resist igniting old passions. 
However, Carol discovers the affair with tragic consequences, as she aborts her unborn child and flees Walford. 
Meanwhile, Ricky is left heartbroken by Bianca as she tells him she no long loves him and runs off to Manchester before he finds out the truth. Dan Sullivan just couldn't keep his hands off Bianca (Photo: Adam Pensotti) 
Syed Masood and Christian Clarke 
Christian Clarke and Syed Masood were the one couple that fans couldn't wait to get together. 
After the Masood's eldest son, estranged from the family due to Syed's shifty dealings which Masood took the blame for, Syed arrived in Walford with his girlfriend, Amira. 
However, as he begins to mend ties with his family, Syed begins to work for them - meeting Christian (Jane's brother). 
Unable to deny their mutual attraction, the pair end up having sex at work, and the slippery slope begins. Syed Masood and Christian Clarke were a fan favourite couple from the start (Photo: BBC) 
Finding his sexuality conflicting with his faith, Syed marries Amira, but not before he declares his love for Christian - though he is pressured into the marriage by his pushy mother, Zainab. 
After a short spell of being truly miserable, Syed refvelas the truth to Amira, but following a reprisal from her father Christian is left injured and rejects Syed. 
Following a short seperation and attending some dubious therapy sessions, Christian finally bows to Syed's overtures of love as he declares he is both Muslim and gay - with the couple moving in together. Read More
